message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO 

The paper deals with the joint concerns of self-adaptation and security in multiparty communications. The focus is on preventing security violations and adapting the system to preserve security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the local and global mechanisms for reacting to security violations, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper proposes a model of self-adaptive, multiparty communications, which could fall under cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper also mentions choreography, which is a term used in the field of programming languages and compilers, indicating that it could belong to cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the paper discusses type soundness results, which could suggest that it belongs to cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science).
